title: Ranking the best NFL teams to watch: Turn your TV to the Commanders, Ravens and ... Falcons?
content: Which NFL teams are must-watches every Sunday this season? We stacked all 32 by excitement, fun and intrigue, starting with Washington.

title: Projecting next year's QB market: Most likely scenarios and long shot possibilities
content: We picked teams with some level of QB1 uncertainty for 2026 and projected two potential outcomes for each.

title: Bucs' Godwin, Wirfs to come off PUP but not play
content: The Buccaneers plan to activate Chris Godwin and Tristan Wirfs off the active/PUP list and have the two stars on their 53-man roster to start the season.

title: Report: Bullet fired into Reid's office in May '24
content: A bullet penetrated the glass in the practice facility office of Andy Reid while the Chiefs coach was working alone in it last year, The Kansas City Star reported Wednesday night.

title: Ohtani rocked, struck by liner in 'regrettable' start
content: Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani gave up five earned runs and nine hits in four innings, and got hit on his thigh by a 93 mph line drive in an 8-3 loss to the Rockies.

title: Texans' Ward facing domestic violence civil suit
content: Houston Texans safety Jimmie Ward, who was arrested in June on a domestic violence charge, is now being sued by the woman he allegedly assaulted.

title: Bueckers lights up L.A. for WNBA rookie-record 44
content: Dallas guard Paige Bueckers scored a WNBA rookie-record 44 points Wednesday night, but the Wings came up short in a buzzer-beating loss to the Sparks.

title: Sources: Jets land Phillips in 2nd DT trade of day
content: The Jets acquired Harrison Phillips from Minnesota, sources told ESPN, their second trade of the day for a defensive tackle after they added Jowon Briggs from the Browns.

title: 49ers trade for WR Moore as Robinson suspended
content: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Wednesday on San Francisco's KNBR radio that wide receiver Demarcus Robinson has been suspended three games stemming from a misdemeanor DUI charge.

title: Yankees tie MLB mark with 14 HRs over 2 games
content: New York finished with five home runs Wednesday night and 14 in the series sweep of the Rays, tying a major league record (Reds, 1999) for most homers in a two-game series.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone top this No. 1 team?
content: Baseball's top team is still rolling -- though might be slowing down -- while one NL contender continues its fall down our list in Week 21.

title: Real or Not: Injuries will keep Indiana out of the WNBA playoffs
content: Which teams might host? Could New York fall to the 4-seed? We examine the teams in the WNBA playoff hunt.

title: Vince Young's rise to college football legend began at Ohio State
content: Texas' 2005 title run started in Columbus, where Arch Manning and the Longhorns look to build a new legacy in '25.

title: Tour Championship rankings: From Scottie Scheffler all the way to No. 30
content: Who comes in at No. 2 behind Scheffler? Where do U.S. Ryder Cup hopefuls rank? We break down the entire Tour Championship field.

title: Did Broncos win Devaughn Vele trade? How'd the Jets fare in Harrison Phillips deal? Grading offseason trades
content: Who won the Broncos-Saints trade? What about the Jalen Ramsey-Minkah Fitzpatrick swap? We sized up the offseason's trades.

title: Inside Brock Purdy's massive raise -- and the expectations for 2025 that follow
content: Purdy spent the offseason working on little things to improve his game after securing the biggest raise in NFL history.

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Does McKennie have Juve future?
content: Weston McKennie has barely featured for Juventus in preseason. Will he need to leave to ensure he's a starter for the U.S at next summer's World Cup?

title: 32 pick projections, eight months out: Yates’ early NFL mock draft of Round 1 has some surprises
content: Could Arch Manning go No. 1? Will QBs dominate the first round? Which teams could land playmakers? Field Yates projects next year's opening 32 picks.

title: The best picks for each draft slot in Rounds 1 and 2 in 10-team leagues
content: Being prepared for anything gives you a leg up on draft day. We go through every slot to help you plan ahead and get off to a good start in your draft.

title: How mid-major coaches are embracing -- or resisting -- being high-major launchpads
content: Some mid-major coaches lean into pitching their programs as a development step. Others are reluctant.

title: 10 European storylines to follow: Liverpool and City rebuild, Barca's defense, more
content: Even with predictable title races, each season has its own personality and plotlines. So here are 10 fun plots we're particularly interested in following across Europe as 2025-26 kicks into gear.

title: How Leagues Cup is becoming a hotbed for global scouting
content: With 36 Liga MX and MLS teams playing in Leagues Cup, interest in North American players is on the rise.

title: Predicting how Wirtz, Gyökeres and other big Premier League transfers will perform in 2025-26
content: Loads of big names have arrived in the Premier League this summer, so it's time for Luis Miguel Echegaray to break down who might succeed or flop.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Rogers, Eze after Havertz injury
content: Arsenal are closing on Crystal Palace star Eberechi Eze but are also tracking Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers.

title: Five things to watch in NCAA women's volleyball this season
content: Nebraska, Penn State, Pitt and Louisville are the top four ranked teams as the 2025 volleyball season opens.

title: AFC South betting preview: Texans favored; will Colts, Jags, Titans beat expectations?
content: Is it the Texans' division to lose, or will another team step up? Here are all the odds for each team in the AFC South and our favorite bets.

title: Red Sox icon Jason Varitek decides fantasy football draft order with batting practice
content: The Red Sox called on the 2005 Silver Slugger (and current Boston coach) to be the deciding factor of their fantasy draft order.

title: Jalen Brunson, Natalia Bryant star together in new Nike Kobe sneaker ad
content: A key feature of the new Nike Kobe 3 Protro is diamond shapes on the upper and outsole in honor of Natalia.

title: 'Silence emboldens bully': China targets Trump's tariffs; 'firmly' stands with India
content: Following Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi's visit, Ambassador Xu Feihong voiced opposition to US tariffs on India, advocating for stronger India-China cooperation as vital for regional growth. Both nations aim to enhance strategic trust, manage differences through dialogue, and seek fair boundary resolutions, including reopening border trade markets and improving trans-border river cooperation.

title: India-Russia ties: EAM Jaishankar meets President Vladimir Putin
content: During his Russia visit, External Affairs Minister Jaishankar met President Putin to discuss bilateral ties amidst US tariffs on Indian goods and Russian oil purchases. Discussions with Foreign Minister Lavrov focused on strengthening cooperation in various sectors and preparing for the annual summit.

title: 'Bright MPs, insecure leadership': PM Modi's dig at Rahul as Monsoon session ends
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his disappointment over the repeated disruptions in Parliament during the monsoon session, which resulted in low productivity. He indirectly criticized the Congress leadership for allegedly sidelining younger MPs due to insecurity. The session was marked by opposition protests and the passage of key legislation without thorough debate, leading to significant time lost in parliamentary proceedings.

title: 'Results of last LS polls manipulated’: Rahul doubles down on 'vote chori' charge
content: Rahul Gandhi has confidently alleged manipulation in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls during a rally in Munger, Bihar. He accused the BJP of 'vote chori' to benefit industrialists, vowing to prevent such actions with the Election Commission. Gandhi asserted this 'vote chori' is an attack on the Constitution.

title: 'Marking my territory': TVK chief roars at TN rally; no tie-ups with BJP, DMK
content: Vijay, the actor-turned-politician and president of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), announced his candidacy for the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections from Madurai East, directly challenging the ruling DMK. He asserted TVK's commitment to Tamil causes, including retrieving Katchatheevu island, and criticized the DMK government's actions against protesting sanitation workers.

title: Elon Musk teen prodigy quits after 2 yrs: Tech CEO responds, ‘Never heard of him’
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX departure, despite the 16-year-old prodigy's two-year tenure at the company. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges in quantitative finance. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity gatekeeping.

title: Gujarat school called water tanker instead of ambulance; boy bled for 30 mins
content: A Class 10 student, Nayan Santani, died after a stabbing at his school in Maninagar. Parents allege the school prioritized cleaning bloodstains over medical assistance. The school allegedly called a water tanker instead of an ambulance. Police and education officials are investigating the school's actions. A preliminary report indicates the school failed to provide immediate medical aid.

title: Trump's claim on India falls flat: US embassy denies USAID for voter turnout
content: The MEA informed the Rajya Sabha that the US Embassy refuted President Trump's claim of USAID allocating $21 million to boost voter turnout in India. The embassy clarified that USAID/India never funded or implemented any voter turnout activities from 2014 to 2024. USAID operations in India have ceased, with funding between 2022 and 2024 directed towards various sectors, excluding elections.

title: Zuckerberg hits brake: Meta stops hiring and blocks transfers
content: Meta has halted AI division hiring amidst a restructuring of its 'Superintelligence Lab,' following a massive recruitment drive that lured talent from competitors with exorbitant compensation packages. This freeze comes after disappointing AI model performance and significant leadership departures, raising investor concerns about Meta's spiraling AI costs and the return on investment.

title: Security concerns: Suspected drone sighted over border area of Jammu; probe under way
content: A suspected drone sighting in the Gajansoo border area of Jammu district on Thursday prompted a search operation by security agencies. Residents reported the incident, leading to a response from police and security forces. Authorities are investigating the drone's origin, with concerns heightened due to ongoing drone activity along the International Border, which is guarded by the Border Security Force.

title: Nvidia's $920M headquarters covered with monumental triangles
content: Nvidia's $920 million headquarters in Santa Clara, California, showcases the company's history and tech-driven culture. The campus, featuring Voyager and Endeavor buildings, uses triangular motifs reflecting Nvidia's 3D graphics roots. AI-assisted design optimized daylight, acoustics, and collaboration spaces. The design incorporates 511 triangular skylights and over 14,000 plants, blending nature and technology for a sustainable, innovative workplace.

title: 'In future, PM Modi's Hindutva will seem ...': Kishor defends remarks on BJP
content: Prashant Kishor defended his remark about the BJP's shift towards hardline politics, suggesting that future leaders might make even Narendra Modi's tenure seem moderate. He illustrated the BJP's ideological evolution, noting how perceptions of leaders like Vajpayee and Advani have changed over time. Kishor cautioned that this trend could intensify in the coming years.

title: Asia Cup squad | Where does Gill’s elevation as vice-captain leave Hardik?
content: Once considered Rohit Sharma's successor, Hardik Pandya's captaincy aspirations have faded due to injuries and fitness concerns, leading to Suryakumar Yadav's rise as a preferred leader. Despite losing the captaincy role to SKY and Shubman Gill, Pandya's influence within the team remains significant.

title: Suspense ends on IND vs PAK clash in Asia Cup: Sports ministry issues new policy
content: Indian cricket team is set to participate in the upcoming ACC Asia Cup in UAE, as confirmed by the Sports Ministry. This decision comes amidst a continued freeze on bilateral sporting events between India and Pakistan. The ministry clarified that while bilateral contests remain suspended, India will not obstruct multilateral tournaments.

title: Gabrielle Union on Dwyane Wade; family doubted 9-year age gap; ‘took years to earn'
content: Gabrielle Union revealed that Dwyane Wade's family, particularly his sister Tragil, initially doubted their relationship due to their age difference. Union acknowledged it took years to earn their trust, as they questioned her intentions. Over time, they built mutual trust and now share a strong bond, navigating their blended family's complexities together.

title: Only one laddoo? MP man dials CM helpline; files complaint
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district, Kamlesh Kushwaha lodged a complaint on the CM helpline because he received only one laddoo instead of two during Independence Day celebrations. Despite the panchayat purchasing extra laddoos for redistribution, Kushwaha refused to accept them. Officials revealed that Kushwaha has a history of filing numerous complaints.

title: 'Planned disruption': Centre blames oppn for washout - what Monsoon session achieved
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harisvansh criticized the opposition for disrupting the Monsoon session, leading to significantly reduced productivity in both houses. Birla lamented the loss of discussion time, while Harivansh highlighted the low percentage of work accomplished.

title: 'What doesn’t kill you ... ': Rishabh Pant pens emotional post; shares recovery update
content: Rishabh Pant, the Indian wicketkeeper-batter, has shared a massive update on his recovery from a fractured toe sustained during the fourth Test against England. He revealed the removal of the hard cast on his injured leg, expressing optimism and determination. Pant emphasized the importance of positivity and self-belief in overcoming setbacks, drawing on his past experiences with injury rehabilitation with a post on Instagram.

title: Parliament passes online gaming bill: Key provisions, aims - what Centre said
content: The Rajya Sabha has approved The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, aiming to regulate the rapidly growing online gaming sector and mitigate risks associated with money-based gaming. The bill categorizes online games into e-sports, online social games, and online money games, promoting the first two while strictly regulating the latter due to public health concerns.

title: Kerala Youth Cong chief resigns: Actor, writer allege harassment; 'invited me to hotel'
content: Rahul Mamkoottathil, Youth Congress state President, resigned amidst allegations made by women. At a press conference in Adoor, he claimed the accusations were a diversion from LDF government issues. Rahul asserted his innocence, stating no formal complaint was filed against him.

title: GST revamp: GoM backs Centre’s two-slab plan; accepts scrapping 12% & 28% rates
content: A Group of Ministers (GoM) has accepted a proposal to streamline the GST rate structure, reducing it from four slabs to two. The existing 12% and 28% rates would be eliminated, leaving standard rates of 5% and 18%. This reform aims to simplify the indirect tax system, provide relief to various sectors, and create a more transparent and growth-oriented regime.

title: 'It’s a war': Gretzky’s legacy came under fire amid Trump’s trade war with Canada
content: Brantford, Ontario, Wayne Gretzky's hometown, faces economic challenges due to U.S. tariffs on Canadian goods. Local businesses, like Roustan Hockey, grapple with new trade restrictions, potentially impacting production and employment. While the tariffs stir controversy around Gretzky's ties to Trump, Brantford residents show resilience by supporting local products amidst economic uncertainty.

title: ‘Lives of 3 lakh dogs’: What Delhi CM attacker told police during interrogation
content: Rajesh Sakriya Khimjibhai, accused of attacking Delhi CM Rekha Gupta, claimed his actions were motivated by concerns for Delhi's dog population. Currently in police custody, Khimjibhai's claims are under investigation, with authorities examining his phone, social media, and travel history. The assault, which occurred during a public interaction, is being treated as a potential assassination attempt.

title: 'Talked about traffic': MNS' Raj Thackeray squashes tie-up rumours
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray met with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to address critical urban planning and traffic congestion issues, particularly after heavy rainfall in Mumbai. Thackeray emphasized the need for long-term solutions, stricter enforcement of traffic rules, and public participation. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar downplayed the meeting's political significance, highlighting communication as a state tradition.

title: The Undertaker rumored to join Bigg Boss 19; Mike Tyson also in talks
content: Wrestling legend The Undertaker, Mark Calaway, is reportedly in talks to appear on the 19th season of the Indian reality show, Big Boss. Rumors suggest he might join as a wild card entry for a week-long stay, hosted by Salman Khan. Boxing icon Mike Tyson is also being considered for a guest appearance.

title: Ssshhh! Chess and the challenges of playing in front of a live audience
content: A grandmaster chess tournament in New Delhi highlights the traditional, silent atmosphere of the game, contrasting sharply with a recent event in Las Vegas where live audiences roared at every move. Players express concerns about distractions caused by spectators, questioning whether chess is truly ready for a live audience setting.

title: Explained: India’s MBBS and PG seat boom what it means for future doctors
content: India has significantly increased its MBBS and postgraduate medical seats, aiming to boost healthcare accessibility and quality. While capacity has expanded considerably, particularly in states like Uttar Pradesh and Tamil Nadu, challenges persist with seat vacancies and ensuring uniform educational standards. Initiatives by the NMC and government programs are underway to address these issues and improve medical education.

title: Terror on wings: Pigeon carrying warning to blow up Jammu rly station caught
content: A pigeon carrying a threatening message, allegedly dispatched from Pakistan, was captured near the International Border in Jammu. The note, written in Urdu and English, warned of an imminent IED attack on the Jammu railway station, prompting heightened security measures.

title: FIR against Rahul Gandhi’s driver after cop injured during Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: An FIR has been lodged against the driver of Rahul Gandhi's vehicle after it reportedly hit a police constable during the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar's Nawada district. The incident occurred when the constable tripped and fell in front of the convoy. While the BJP criticized Gandhi, he was later seen assisting the injured officer.

title: LAC row: India to keep tight vigil; Several PLA arms brigades still remain forward deployed
content: "The way China has built roads, bridges, tunnels and habitats along the entire LAC, from eastern Ladakh to Arunachal, over the last five years, PLA troops can easily afford to pull back 100-150km and then come back again in 2-3 hours," a senior Army officer told TOI. ​Our forces cannot. This huge time differential in mobilisation between the rival forces will have to be factored in during any de-escalation talks,a senior Army officer said.

title: Ahmedabad student murder: ‘Kon hain, kya karlega tu?’ Accused’s shocking chat surfaces on social media
content: Viral WhatsApp chats allegedly reveal the accused admitting to stabbing Nayan Satani, a Class 10 student, during an altercation. The messages show the accused recounting the incident and identifying the victim. A friend advises him to delete the chats and flee, prompting a police investigation into the authenticity of these exchanges as crucial evidence in the ongoing case.

title: 'No signal from Moscow to end war': Zelenskyy seeks US response if Putin avoids talks
content: President Zelensky has firmly stated Ukraine will not recognize Russia's territorial claims, demanding security guarantees within days before any talks. He seeks a strong US reaction if Russia avoids bilateral meetings, while outlining ambitious defense production plans. Amidst ongoing Russian attacks, Zelensky urges increased international pressure and support, emphasizing Moscow's disinterest in peace.

title: Top 15 highest-paying jobs in the US that could make you rich
content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that specialized medical professionals like ophthalmologists, physicians, and radiologists top the list of highest-paying jobs, earning $239,200+ annually. These roles demand extensive education, rigorous training, and critical decision-making. Airline pilots also secure high salaries, reflecting their responsibility for passenger safety and efficient flight operations, with a median annual pay of $226,600.

title: 100 on debut! Prithvi Shaw announces Maharashtra arrival: 'Glad to start this way'
content: Prithvi Shaw marked his Maharashtra debut with a resilient century against Chhattisgarh in the Buchi Babu Tournament 2025, held in Chennai. After a top-order collapse, Shaw's 111-run innings stabilised the team, showcasing a return to form after a challenging period. This performance reignites hopes for a career resurgence as he aims to carry this momentum into the Ranji Trophy season.

title: Big revelation! 'He was better than Sachin Tendulkar': Vinod Kambli's brother
content: Virendra Kambli, brother of Vinod Kambli, speaks about Vinod and Sachin Tendulkar. He says Vinod never felt superior to Sachin. Virendra emphasises their strong friendship. Sachin still supports Vinod. They shared camaraderie during Ranji Trophy matches. Virendra recalls fun times in the dressing room. Vinod's Test average was impressive. Sachin became a record-breaking legend. Their bond remains strong.

title: Attack on Delhi CM Rekha Gupta: Attacker aspired to open animal hospital, loved dogs
content: Rajkot police identified Rajesh Sakariya, an autorickshaw driver and ardent dog lover, as the man who assaulted the Delhi chief minister. Sakariya's mother stated he is mentally unstable and was upset about the Supreme Court's ruling on stray dogs in Delhi, believing the chief minister would enforce it.

title: ‘Bengali speakers must be Bangladeshis’: CU students attacked with hockey sticks, knives
content: Calcutta University students residing at Carmichael Hostel were assaulted by Hindi-speaking hawkers near Sealdah Bridge after being taunted for speaking Bengali and labeled as Bangladeshis. The altercation escalated from a price negotiation dispute to a violent attack with rods, hockey sticks, and knives, resulting in serious injuries to four students.

title: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar Meets Russian President Vladimir Putin In Moscow
content: "We believe that relations between India and Russia have been among the steadiest of the major relationships in the world after the Second World War," Mr Jaishankar said at a joint media briefing with Mr Lavrov.

title: Dinosaur-Era Fossils Unearthed Near Lake In Rajasthan Village
content: Fossil-like remains, including a large bone-shaped structure, were discovered in a village in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer district on Wednesday, raising the possibility of the site being linked to the prehistoric dinosaur era.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Highlights: Online Gaming Bill Passed In Rajya Sabha
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw tabled 'The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025' in Rajya Sabha on the last day of the Monsoon Session

title: Bipartisan Chorus Warns Trump On China Amid "Tariff Tantrum" Vs India
content: US President Donald Trump has faced the scrutiny of friends and foes alike since he all but declared an economic war against India

title: Video: Nitish Kumar Offered 'Topi' At Bihar Madrasa Event. This Happens
content: Nearly twelve years after he took a swipe at Narendra Modi, then his bitter rival, and said a leader has to embrace both 'topi' and 'tilak' to run the country, a video showing JDU president Nitish Kumar refusing to weara 'topi' is viral

title: 574 Drones, 40 Missiles: Russia Hammers Ukraine As Peace Talks Drag
content: Russia launched one of its biggest aerial attacks of the year on Ukraine, firing 574 drones and 40 ballistic and cruise missiles overnight.

title: Delhi Police Commissioner Shunted Out A Day After Chief Minister Attacked
content: A day after Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was attacked by a man during a public meeting at her residence, Delhi Police Commissioner SBK Singh has been replaced by 1992 batch officer Satish Golcha.

title: Moscow Interest in Joint Energy Projects With India, Says Russia's Foreign Minister
content: Russia and India have achieved good results in energy cooperation and Moscow is interested in working on joint energy projects with New Delhi, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov told his Indian counterpart in Moscow.

title: UK Bans Shower Gel Ad That Suggested "White Skin Was Superior"
content: A British advertising watchdog has banned a Sanex shower gel commercial after ruling it "could be interpreted as suggesting that white skin was superior to black skin."

title: Monsoon Session Ends Amid Disruptions, Just 31% Productivity In Lok Sabha
content: The Monsoon Session of Parliament, which began on July 21, 2025, concluded on Thursday after 21 sittings over 32 days, with both Houses registering low productivity because of repeated disruptions.

title: First Security Guarantees, Then Putin Summit: Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he could meet with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, but only after his allies agree security guarantees for Ukraine to deter future Russian attacks once the fighting stops.

title: Ukrainian Suspected In Nord Stream Pipeline Blasts Arrested In Italy
content: A Ukrainian citizen man suspected to be one of the coordinators of the undersea explosions in 2022 that damaged the Nord Stream gas pipelines between Russia and Germany has been arrested.

title: Suspended Thai Prime Minister Testifies Over Call That Could Get Her Booted
content: Thailand's suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra testified in a Bangkok court on her alleged breach of an ethics law in her handling of a border dispute with Cambodia, a case that could see her forced out of her job entirely.

title: Greta Thunberg, Activists Block Norway Oil Refinery In Protest
content: Greta Thunberg and more than 100 more climate activists blocked Oslo's main avenue and a bank branch on Thursday to demand Norway shutter its oil industry, police and organisers said.

title: Tourist In Hot Water For Pole Dance On Turkish Flagpole
content: A foreign tourist was facing a criminal probe for offending "the nation's moral values" for performing a pole dance on a Turkish flagpole in the tourist hotspot of Cappadocia.

title: Need To Address Trade Imbalance Between India And Russia: S Jaishankar In Moscow
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted the trade deficit of $58.9 billion between Russia and India, despite more than a fivefold rise in bilateral goods trade over the last four years.

title: Americans Worry Democracy In Danger Amid Gerrymandering Fights: Survey
content: Most Americans believe that efforts to redraw US House of Representatives districts to maximise partisan gains, like those under way in Texas and California, are bad for democracy, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found.

title: Actor Vijay's Supporter Dies On Way To TVK's Mega Madurai Rally
content: A 33-year-old supporter of Tamil actor and politician Vijay died today while travelling to attend the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) mega state conference in Madurai.

title: What do NFL scouts think of Arch Manning and what can Texas expect from him?
content: arch Manning will get his chance to be the face of the longhorns this season . he won't get the chance to ease into the starting role as top-ranked Texas will play at defending national champion and no. 3-ranked Ohio State in its season opener on august 30 .

content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: Jake Paul vs. Gervonta Davis: All you need to know about the Nov. 14 fight
content: a fight between a 135-pound world champion and a YouTuber-turned-prizefighter has come out of nowhere . the announcement comes as a potential heavyweight showdown with former unified champion Anthony Joshua . a rematch with lamont Roach Jr. has been linked to the fight .

title: Updated top 100 MLB prospect rankings: There's a new No. 1
content: a lot has changed since the last time we ranked the top MLB prospects . some of the prospects in our ranking are in different places after a busy trade deadline . this is my ranking of these players for the long term, considering their upside, risk and proximity to the big leagues .

content: a list of the top 10 college football players entering the season is no easy task . it requires a mix of information, reporting and assumptions . some choices are easy and some projections are nearly universally agreed upon . at least a few will be hisman Trophy contenders by season's end .

title: CFB Player Rank: Who should've made the top 10? What were the biggest surprises?
content: the big Ten is floating the idea of expanding the College Football Playoff to 24 or 28 teams . the college football reporters break down the entire ranking, including what players our committee missed entirely . our selection committee included Bill Connelly, David Hale, Chris Low, Adam Rittenberg and Paolo Uggetti.

title: Inside 'Camp Glenn': Tackling the owner, a vintage whistle and a full-circle moment
content: first-year coach was the defensive coordinator of the Detroit Lions . he lost 45 of his first 64 games before reaching the AFC Championship game in 1998 . the new york Jets are preparing for the playoffs on tuesday .

title: 'I'm living proof': How Lucas Erceg is using his sobriety journey to inspire others
content: the softball field at Boonville Correctional Center has two fences . the first is a standard outfield fence stretching from foul line to foul line . it's a stark reminder that the field is, quite literally, a diamond in the rough .

title: NFC South betting preview: Can Falcons or Panthers make noise?
content: the Tampa Bay Buccaneers are even-money favorites to win a fifth straight NFC South title in 2025 . they have the highest projected win total (9.5) in the division . the Falcons won eight games last season and their win total at ESPN BET sits at 7.5 .

title: ↔️ 2026 college football recruiting class rankings
content: the recruiting wheel keeps spinning and has resulted in some movers . the race for positioning in the rankings, including at the very top, never seems settled until signing day in December makes it all official . ESPN 300 commits: 19 Top offensive prospect: OT Keenyi Pepe Top defensive prospect: CB Elbert Hill No program has more 2026 momentum than USC under Lincoln Riley .

title: What to know about the 2025 PFL middleweight, light heavyweight and heavyweight finals
content: the PFL ends its 2025 season in a big way on Thursday in Hollywood, Florida . heavyweight and light heavyweight are among the final three weight classes to crown tournament champions . the main event pits 2024 PFL heavyweight finalist Oleg Popov against Alexander Romanov .

title: 'Perplexed': EAM Jaishankar slams US, EU hypocrisy over Russia trade
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: The Unforgotten: Two QBs and the game that tied them together forever
content: quarterback ONE IS JAY KUTNER . he is a senior, 17 years old, wears no. 5 . his team is playing a preseason scrimmage against a public school . the coach is dissatisfied -- execution or effort, it hardly matters .

title: Predictions, X factors for the 2025 PLL quarterfinals
content: the 2025 premier lacrosse league playoffs will be down to four by the end of the weekend . the quarterfinals will take place at TCO Stadium in Minneapolis . it's time for a Western showdown between the Carolina Chaos and the California Redwoods .

title: Health officials in Kozhikode checking if well water could be PAM source
content: A three-month-old child and a 40-year-old man from Kozhikode and an 11-year-old child from Chelari in Malappuram are undergoing treatment for PAM at the MCH

title: Literature festivals are windows to democracy, says Satchidanandan
content: Akademi library named after Lalithambika Antharjanam. International Literature Festival of Kerala concludes in Thrissur

title: Second flood warning remains in force in Bhadrachalam, TGSRTC bus services paralysed in Bhadrachalam Agency
content: The official machinery has been put on high alert and the disaster response force personnel have been deployed in the flood-prone areas of the tribal dominated Bhadradri Kothagudem district to deal with any potential flooding hazards

title: Flood alert issued in A.P. amid continuing heavy inflows into Godavari, Krishna
content: People living in low-lying areas told to remain vigilant as streams and rivulets are overflowing in several regions; storage levels in reservoirs rise further, showing significant improvement over last year

title: Data furnished in LS indicates low adherence to high security registration plates
content: Data for Telangana was not available as the Transport department is in the process of migrating to Vahan platform

title: Andhra Pradesh Revenue Department wins two SKOCH Awards for 2025
content: Online Court Management System and Re-Survey 2.0 win national recognition, says Revenue Minister Anagani Satya Prasad

title: Railways to operate 12,000 special trains during Deepavali, Chhath festivals
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says passengers undertaking onward journeys between October 13 and 26 and return journeys between November 17 and December 1 will be offered a 20% discount on return tickets

title: ‘Now is the time to build a true Bharatiya model curriculum to nurture a healthy society’
content: British education system of 1835 derailed our curriculum to produce clerks, says Shankaranand at national conference in Kalaburagi

title: Bill passed to seize properties derived from illegal mining
content: It seeks to appoint a recovery commissioner, a serving or retired officer, not below the rank of Additional Chief Secretary, to seize and attach the properties

title: AP Chambers urges Andhra Pradesh govt. to release pending incentives of ₹5,000 crore as one-time payment
content: Industries, especially the MSMEs, are troubled by steep rise in production costs, and their plight is aggravated by the tariffs being imposed by the U.S., says Potluri Bhaskar Rao

title: Kerala blazes a digital trail by achieving 100% digital literacy
content: After its much-acclaimed 100% literacy campaign, Kerala has crossed yet another milestone by achieving total digital literacy. S.R. Praveen meets some of the new digitally literate citizens and people who led the campaign

title: Jaishankar meets Russian President Putin, discusses India-Russia ties
content: The meeting came hours after Mr. Jaishankar held wide-ranging talks with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov that largely focused on expanding the trade ties between India and Russia

title: Over 15,000 2BHKs in Hyderabad occupied after first notices
content: 23,255 allotted houses yet to be taken over; 7 lakh people in four districts found to be eligible as they do not have a site to construct a house

title: AIADMK former Minister files PIL in Madras High Court for purification of electoral rolls
content: He says failure to delete fraudulent, ineligible and dead voters from the rolls could affect the poll results in a big way

title: Election Commission appoints two additional secretaries as observers for vice-presidential poll
content: The poll authority said Sushil Kumar Lohani, Additional Secretary in Ministry of Panchayati Raj and D. Anandan, Additional Secretary in Ministry of Finance, Department of Expenditure, have been appointed as observers

title: Nearly 4,000 contempt cases pending against government since 2022: H.K. Patil
content: Amendment mandates that departments appoint a designated officer to oversee the enforcement and compliance with court orders

title: Plantation unions announce protest against POABS Group, lockout continues on Haileyburia estate
content: Estates under the POABS Group have been withholding salary and benefits to employees. A company source says the company is trying to avoid lockout and continue the functioning of the estates

title: Kerala declared first fully digitally literate State in the country
content: In the surveys carried out among 1.5 crore people from 83.46 lakh families across the State, 21.88 lakh people were identified as digitally illiterate. Out of this, 21.87 lakh people, comprising 99.98% of the participants have completed the training and successfully completed the evaluation

title: Bureaucracy that forgets the people forgets its purpose, says Kerala High Court
content: Court discharges a person charged with ‘assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of duty,’ saying that if the officials had adopted a pragmatic approach, the entire incident could have been avoided

title: Jharkhand State schools to teach Shibu Soren’s life from next academic year
content: The state’s School Education and Literacy Department has decided to include a chapter each on the life of the veteran JMM leader through eight textbooks from Class 1 to 12.

title: Dharwad officials told to speed up work on women’s college
content: Deputy Commissioner visits construction site and speaks to officials and reviews the progress of work

title: TVK will script political history in 2026 Assembly elections, says Vijay
content: “TVK’s politics is real, emotional, for the betterment of people; and only for doing good to them,” Vijay said

title: Karnataka ranks ninth in country for groundwater depletion
content: Council adopts Karnataka Groundwater (Regulation and Control of Development and Management) (Amendment) Bill, 2025, for groundwater conservation

title: Kalaburagi officials told to act to prevent calamities due to heavy rain
content: Deputy Commissioner assesses situation caused by incessant rainfall, including loss of lives, damage to houses and crop destruction

title: Several bridges in Yadgir, Raichur come under river waters, villages are facing flood threat
content: Yadgir Deputy Commissioner takes stock of the situation, Raichur Deputy Commissioner issues flood alert

title: Council clears 1% fire cess on high-rise buildings
content: Only those buildings which are taller than 21 metres to be levied; buildings owned by the State and Central governments or other public authorities are to be exempted

title: No first-time Aadhaar card to be issued for people above 18 years in Assam from October 18: CM Himanta
content: A Cabinet decision was taken in this regard to prevent foreigners living illegally in India from getting hold of the unique identification number, said CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Parliament session fruitful for government and country, unsuccessful for Opposition: Rijiju
content: The government has to discharge its duties to people in the national interest," he said. The Opposition cannot prevent the government from working with its protests, says Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 42,000 Myanmar nationals mapped since December 2024: Assam Rifles
content: People from across the border stay temporarily in four northeastern States, returning to their country as per the new Free Movement Regime policy, the paramilitary force said

title: Report recommends restoring State autonomy in health and medical education for better outcomes
content: According to the report, submitted to the High-Level Committee on Union-State Relations, set up by the government of Tamil Nadu, there are six key areas where the Union government has encroached upon the State’s functioning

title: Congress deplores Modi govt's 'complete silence' on Israel's 'unacceptable actions'
content: The Indian National Congress condemns both these moves. It also very strongly deplores the Modi Government's complete silence on Israel's unacceptable actions, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Karnataka Crowd Control Bill referred to House panel after Opposition seeks clarity on commercial, non-commercial events
content: The Opposition argued that the Bill could end up becoming ‘a weapon’ for the police, especially against political parties

title: Former DG of Border Roads Organisation appointed as Telangana govt advisor on Irrigation
content: Lt. Gen. Harpal Singh  was crucial in completion of Atal and other key tunnels. He earlier offered his expertise in rescue operation at Telangana’s SLBC tunnel.

title: Will not allow BJP to indulge in ‘vote chori’ in collusion with Election Commission: Rahul Gandhi in Bihar
content: Addressing a rally in Bihar on the fifth day of Congress’ ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’, the Congress leader said “vote chori” (vote theft) is an attack on the Constitution

title: High-end surveillance cameras to be operational soon on Kozhikode bypass
content: The Vengalam-Ramanattukara stretch will have 47 cameras which will be linked to a control room at Mampuzha for real-time monitoring

title: Telangana forecast to get break from rain this weekend
content: Hyderabad and its surrounding areas are very likely to receive light rain or thundershowers accompanied with gusty winds (30-40 kmph) towards evening or night.

title: Senior IPS officer Satish Golcha appointed Delhi Police Commissioner
content: Previously, S.B.K. Singh, was given additional charge as the Delhi Police Commissioner on August 1, 2025

title: Cancer should be declared notifiable disease across States, Union Territories: Parliamentary panel
content: The Committee recommended imposing a high-risk cess or heavy taxes on tobacco products and said that the revenue earned may be utilised for supplementing cancer research and cancer care across the country

title: HUDCO international convention centre to come up in Amaravati, says Pemmasani
content: The project, to be developed on 10 acres under HUDCO, has already secured preliminary approval for eight acres from the Andhra Pradesh CRDA

title: Madras High Court dismisses IIT-Madras professor’s plea against findings of sexual harassment inquiry
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh refuses to interfere with the CCASH inquiry report as well as a show-cause notice issued by the Director of IIT-M

title: BJD knocks door of MoTA over Polavaram project potentially threatening tribals in Odisha
